intro: Psychotria pumiliocarpa, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria pumiliocarpa is notable for its role in supporting local biodiversity and its potential medicinal properties.
